section.para: &opscon; will always be accessed over port 9095.

section.title: Required Access Credentials
section.para: In previous versions of &opscon; you were required to have only the password for the Administrator account (admin by default). Now the Administrator user account must also have all of the following credentials:

row.entry: Admin role on at least one project
Admin or Monasca-user role on admin project

important.para: If your login account has administrator role on the administrator project, then you only need to make sure you have the administrator role on the default domain.

section.para: During installation, an administrator account called admin is created by default.
During installation, an administrator password is randomly created by default. It is not recommend that you change the default password.

section.title: Connect Through a Browser
section.para: The following instructions will show you how to find the URL to access &opscon;. You will use SSH, also known as Secure Socket Shell, which provides administrators with a secure way to access a remote computer.

listitem.para: Locate the URL or IP address for the &opscon; with the following command:
listitem.screen: source ~/service.osrc && openstack endpoint list | grep opsconsole | grep admin
| 8ef10dd9c00e4abdb18b5b22adc93e87 | region1 | opsconsole | opsconsole | True | admin | https://192.168.24.169:9095/api/v1/
